column5: Dont know who he is,but loved the way that went through my speakers J.
I think I'd rather listen or greaseless bearings   in their final moments before they disintegrate or maybe fingernails on a chalkboard.
Guess it doesn't bring back the memories to you that it does to me
For sure in my Top 10 teeth cutting tunes  Jam on Bud
another great one gone, made some great tunes
Dang......another great one bites the dust....I'm starting to get old...  RIP

While he's gonna be eulogized a lot for his groundbreaking hard rock/metal playing, let's not forget his subtle,egoless and brilliant work as a sideman. And something from the earlier days with Van Morrison.  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Eq3YLhtuzTQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Bad Motor Scooter is my regular ring tone...And Yes, Joey I think we might have similar memories....lol....TC and tight lines....Chuck....
I was going to say the same thing... Ronnie got on his bad motor Scooter and rode off into the sunset... RIP Ronnie! HH
Rock Candy is a staple on my Ipod and my 19 yr old son put it on his after hearing it. Sammy Hager never did anything as good as what he did with Montrose.

love that stuff had the the first two albums,MONTROSE and PAPER MONEY when I was in high school.Too many of our rock legends succumbing to this awful disease.Ronnie James Dio and now his guitar player Tony Iommi now has it.For those of you who don't know from Black Sabbath and in later years Heaven and Hell.
Ive been a fan from the moment i heard them when i was 16....its because of Montrose i followed Sammys career my entire life....Rock Candy was the beginning of my addiction
